statement.p: Farrell is conducting market research on the cost of homeowners insurance. Farrell has determined that the average annual cost of homeowners insurance is 1325, and that the distribution of costs is normally distributed with a standard deviation of 50.
a. Find the probability that a single randomly selected consumer spends less than 1238 on homeowners insurance.
b. The cost of the middle 80 of homeowners insurance policies falls between (round to the nearest dollar):
c. The most expensive 17 of homeowners insurance policies cost at least how much annually?

b. For the middle 80 of the data, need the remaining 20 of the data split between the left and right tails of the distribution.
